item.title: Who said vim is not an IDE?
item.description: Every developer has a favorite text editor or an IDE, and as long as developers exist, Text Editor wars are not going anywhere. The two main forces of the so called “Editor War” are Vim and Emacs. They are both great and can do a lot, but… but they are not an IDE. I’ve heard many developers, who are in love with vim or Emacs, but use IDEs like clion, CodeBlocks, VisualStudio, etc.
